poem:
Title: An Accord at Mar-a-Lago

Red ties whisper past 
plated towers of influence.
Cameron, Trump, a reluctant dance.
As the palm trees nod, complicit,
Under the indifferent Florida sun.
This varnished kingdom of confluence,
Hovering between xenophobia and decorum.
Behind closed doors, promises bloom,
Into the night, stubbornly clinging to the dimming light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cameron’s Mar-a-Lago lobbying may not be enough to reach the new Republican party Whatever happened at Mar-a-Lago between David Cameron and Donald Trump on Monday night, was clearly going to stay in Mar-a-Lago. Dinner at the Trump Florida residence was always going to be a stiff test of the UK foreign secretary’s influence over the former president, presidential candidate, and the man he had previously referred to variously as protectionist, xenophobic, and misogynistic. When Cameron". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
